Mars.name: Mars
Mars.description: Embark on an adventure to the Red Planet. Explore its rugged terrain, giant volcanoes, and deep canyons.

spacecraft.name: Starship 7
spacecraft.description: A state-of-the-art spacecraft with advanced life support and entertainment systems.

accommodation.name: Mars Base Alpha
accommodation.description: A luxurious habitat providing all the comforts of home, including panoramic views of the Martian landscape.

points_of_interest.name: Olympus Mons
points_of_interest.description: The tallest volcano and mountain in the solar system.

points_of_interest.name: Valles Marineris
points_of_interest.description: A canyon system that runs along the Martian surface.

safety_tips: Always wear your space suit when outside the habitat.
Stay hydrated and consume prescribed vitamins.
Avoid walking alone in unfamiliar terrain.
cultural_etiquette: Acknowledge Martian Time Zones when scheduling activities.
Respect designated preservation areas, avoid leaving any trace behind.

Venus.name: Venus
Venus.description: Travel to our closest neighboring planet. Experience its thick atmosphere and the mysteries hidden beneath its dense clouds.

spacecraft.name: Venus Voyager 2
spacecraft.description: A specialized spacecraft equipped to handle Venus's intense heat and atmospheric pressure.

accommodation.name: Venus Sky Habitat
accommodation.description: A floating habitat suspended within the upper layers of Venus's atmosphere. Experience breathtaking views of the Venusian clouds.

points_of_interest.name: Maxwell Montes
points_of_interest.description: The highest mountain range on Venus.

points_of_interest.name: Aphrodite Terra
points_of_interest.description: The largest highland region on Venus.

safety_tips: Ensure protective gear is worn at all times due to extreme temperatures.
Stay within marked zones in the habitat.
Avoid direct exposure to the sun.
cultural_etiquette: Remember to mark Venus Day which lasts longer than a Venusian year.
Respect the scientific protocols set in place to protect any potential life forms.
